message: Thank you for the recommendation, Alice. However, I'm not comfortable buying without more information. Could you please provide some details about the product's quality, or perhaps offer a lower price?

Alice, I appreciate your honesty in not recommending this product.  While I understand there's always a chance of a good deal, I'm going to pass for now.  Perhaps we can revisit this later if you have more information to share.

Alice, you've not recommended this product twice now. While I respect your judgment, I need to see a little more confidence in your recommendations before I'm willing to take a chance.  Perhaps a better understanding of the product's quality would help.

Alice, this is the fourth round in a row where you haven't recommended the product.  I'm starting to feel like there's a pattern here.  Unless you have some new information to share about this product, I'm going to pass for now. Perhaps we can revisit this later.

Alice, I'm noticing a trend here. You haven't recommended a purchase in a while, and the products you did recommend turned out to be low-quality.  I'm hesitant to trust your recommendation this time, especially since you haven't offered any explanation for your previous lack of recommendations. Perhaps a more detailed description of the product's quality or a price adjustment would help build my confidence.

Alice, I'm still not convinced.  While I appreciate your honesty in not recommending this product,  I need more information about your recommendation process before I'm willing to take a chance. Perhaps you could explain why you've been so hesitant to recommend products in the past?  I'm interested in understanding how you're evaluating the quality of these items.

Alice, I'm starting to feel like there's a disconnect between your recommendations and the actual quality of the products.  I'm not sure what information you're using to make your recommendations, but I'm going to have to pass again. Perhaps we can revisit this later if you have some more transparency about your process.

Alice, I'm starting to lose confidence in this process.  You've consistently not recommended the product, and the few times you have, the products turned out to be low-quality.  Without a better explanation for your recommendations, I'm going to have to pass. Perhaps we can revisit this later if you can provide more transparency and clarity about your decision-making.

Alice, I've seen enough.  Your recommendations haven't been helpful, and I don't trust them anymore. Unless you can offer something more convincing than a simple 'yes' or 'no', I'm going to have to pass on all future products.  Perhaps we can revisit this if you can explain your process better and demonstrate a more reliable way of evaluating product quality.

Alice, I've made up my mind.  Your recommendations have not been helpful, and I'm not willing to continue this process.  I need a more reliable system for evaluating product quality than just your word.  Perhaps we can revisit this in the future if you can offer a better solution.
Alice, I've been consistent in my decision.  I'm no longer interested in your products, and I'm not going to change my mind.  Please respect my decision and stop offering me products.  I'm moving on.
